intro: Sebaea junodii, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its fleshy stems and leaves help it store water, making it drought-tolerant. Sebaea junodii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
